projects.name: Creating My Own Minesweeper
projects.description: A class project to create a Minesweeper clone using assets provided by the professor.
cycling_images: The first prerendered map with debug on to show the shape of the minefield.
The first prerendered map with the only mine flagged.
The first prerendered map with many more flags in play.
The first prerendered map after clicking once in the bottom corner (the flag is from a prior photo as the flags are not generated when the game is won).
The second prerendered map with debug on to show the shape of the minefield.
The third prerendered map with debug on to show the shape of the minefield.
The default game rules for my MineSweeper clone. The numbers represent the number of columns, rows, and mines respectively.
A randomly generated game from the config file.
The same game with the debug function turned on to see the mines.
A new game with the same config rules generated by clicking on the smily face.
The config file changed to only have 5 mines on the game
The new game loaded with only 5 mines
Debug mode turned on to see where the mines are
After 1 click in the middle of the screen to show the cascade effect.

projects.name: Quote Finder
projects.description: Create an application using Java and C++ to implement two different data structures.
cycling_images: This is the front page of the application, which allowed the user to choose between the two different datastructures we implemented.
This capture is how using the map structure implementation looked, where we selected 'love' for the category we wanted to search for.
This is the result of the search from the last image. As you can see, there are arrows on either side that allows the user to see other quotes in that category and a randomizer for a newn search!
